questions.question: The concept of 'Rule of Law' primarily means that:

options.B: Laws only apply to the poor
options.C: Everyone, including government officials, is subject to the law
options.D: Laws are made by the military

questions.question: A constitution is often defined as:

options.B: The supreme law of a country

questions.question: Which of the following is a key feature of a 'Rigid' constitution?

options.A: It can be changed easily by a simple majority
options.B: It is never written down
options.C: It requires a special and difficult procedure to be amended

questions.question: The principle of 'Constitutionalism' implies that:

options.B: The government's authority is determined and limited by a body of law
options.C: There is no need for a judiciary
options.D: The constitution is updated every month

questions.question: An 'Unwritten' constitution is based largely on:

options.B: Secrets kept by the king

questions.question: The main purpose of the 'Separation of Powers' is to:

options.B: Prevent the abuse of power by any single branch
options.D: Give all power to the President

questions.question: Which branch of government has the power to check the Executive by declaring its actions unconstitutional?

options.B: Military

questions.question: In a democratic system, the 'Rule of Law' protects citizens from:

options.B: Natural disasters

questions.question: What is the primary function of the Legislative branch?

options.B: Interpreting the constitution

questions.question: The FDRE Constitution (1995) is an example of a:

options.B: Flexible constitution

questions.question: Judicial Review is the power of the courts to:

options.A: Write new laws for the parliament
options.B: Examine the constitutionality of laws and executive acts

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a pillar of the Rule of Law?

options.B: Transparency in law-making

questions.question: The concept of 'Limited Government' means that:

options.A: The government has a small number of employees
options.B: The government's power is restricted by the constitution
options.C: The government only meets once a year
options.D: The government is not allowed to have an army

questions.question: An independent judiciary is essential because it:

options.A: Follows the orders of the President
options.B: Makes decisions based on the law without political interference
options.C: Always favors the government in court
options.D: Has the power to increase taxes

questions.question: The process of 'Checks and Balances' ensures that:

options.A: Each branch of government can limit the powers of the others
options.B: The bank accounts of the state are balanced
options.C: The government can check people's private emails
options.D: The Legislative branch has all the authority

questions.question: In Ethiopia, the power to interpret the Constitution is given to the:

options.B: House of Federation

questions.question: A 'Flexible' constitution can be amended:

options.B: In the same way as an ordinary law

questions.question: The principle of 'Equality before the Law' means:

options.A: Everyone must have the same amount of money
options.B: Law applies equally to all people regardless of status
options.C: Only citizens are protected by the law
options.D: The law ignores the crimes of rich people

questions.question: Who is the 'Chief Executive' in a parliamentary system like Ethiopia's?

options.B: The Chief Justice

questions.question: The 'Preamble' of a constitution is:

options.A: The list of punishments for crimes
options.B: The introductory statement of its goals and values

questions.question: Arbitrary rule is the opposite of:

options.B: Rule of Law

questions.question: A constitution is 'Supreme' because:

options.A: It is the oldest book in the country
options.B: Any law that contradicts it is null and void
options.C: It was written by a king
options.D: It cannot be read by ordinary people

questions.question: One of the values of the FDRE Constitution is 'Secularism', which means:

options.A: The state and religion are separate
options.B: Everyone must follow one religion
options.C: Religion is banned in the country

questions.question: Democracy is impossible without the 'Rule of Law' because:

options.B: Without it, power is based on the whims of individuals rather than law
options.C: Laws are only found in democratic countries
options.D: People don't like to vote without laws

questions.question: The House of Federation in Ethiopia represents:

options.B: Individual citizens directly
options.C: The Nations, Nationalities, and Peoples of Ethiopia

questions.question: A person accused of a crime has the right to a 'Fair Trial', which is a part of:

options.B: Military discipline

questions.question: Administrative law deals with:

options.B: The activities and powers of government agencies

questions.question: The 'Ombudsman' is an institution that:

options.B: Investigates complaints by citizens against government officials

questions.question: Transparency in government means that:

options.B: Information about government actions is available to the public
options.C: The government knows everything about the citizens
options.D: All government buildings are made of glass

questions.question: Anarchy often leads to:

options.B: Chaos and the rule of the strongest (might is right)

questions.question: Which document is considered the historical foundation for the Rule of Law in England?

options.B: The Social Contract

questions.question: Accountability means that government officials must:

options.B: Be responsible for their actions and explain them to the public

questions.question: Under the Rule of Law, laws must be:

options.B: Clear, publicized, and stable

questions.question: The 'House of Peoples' Representatives' in Ethiopia is the:

options.B: Lower House (Highest authority of the Federal Government)

questions.question: When a constitution is 'codified', it means it is:

options.B: Contained in a single, formal document

questions.question: What is the 'Human Rights' section of the FDRE constitution often called?

options.B: The Bill of Rights (Chapter Three)

questions.question: Individual rights can be limited when they:

options.A: Are used to criticize the king
options.B: Infringe upon the rights of others or national security
options.C: Are too expensive for the government
options.D: Are not liked by the majority

questions.question: The 'Suppremacy Clause' in a constitution ensures that:

options.A: The President is the supreme leader
options.B: The constitution is the highest law in the land
options.C: The army is supreme over the police
options.D: One religion is supreme over others

questions.question: Corruption is a major threat to the Rule of Law because it:

options.B: Leads to unequal application of the law and bias
options.D: Increases the speed of the courts

questions.question: A 'Law-abiding' citizen is someone who:

options.B: Voluntarily respects and follows the legal rules
options.C: Only follows laws when the police are watching

questions.question: Federalism in Ethiopia is designed to:

options.A: Centralize all power in Addis Ababa
options.B: Accommodate ethnic and cultural diversity

questions.question: The 'Power of the Purse' (controlling the budget) usually belongs to the:

options.B: Legislative branch

questions.question: In a Rule of Law system, 'Retroactive' laws (laws that punish acts committed before the law was made) are generally:

options.B: Prohibited or discouraged
options.C: The most common types of laws

questions.question: Civil society organizations help promote the Rule of Law by:

options.B: Acting as watchdogs and educating the public

questions.question: The right to 'Habeas Corpus' protects individuals from:

options.B: Unlawful and indefinite detention

questions.question: The 'State of Emergency' provisions in a constitution allow the government to:

options.B: Temporarily limit some rights to protect the nation during a crisis
options.C: Arrest anyone without a reason forever

questions.question: Which of the following is a challenge to the Rule of Law in developing nations?

options.B: Weak institutional capacity and corruption

questions.question: The principle of 'Publicity of Law' means that:

options.A: Laws must be advertised on TV
options.B: The public must know the law before they can be punished for breaking it
options.C: The law must be liked by everyone
options.D: Laws are only for famous people

questions.question: Immunity for government officials usually means:

options.B: They are protected from certain legal actions while in office
options.C: They are above the law forever
options.D: They don't have to follow traffic lights

questions.question: The ultimate goal of the Rule of Law is to ensure:

options.B: The wealth of the ruling party
